title: Extract Water from Palm Trees
brief: Collect sugary fluid from palm flowering stalks for up to 1 liter per day.
steps: Step 1: Locate buri, coconut, or nipa palm with flowering stalk.
Step 2: Bend flowering stalk downward carefully.
Step 3: Cut off the tip of the bent stalk cleanly.
Step 4: Collect the flowing sugary fluid in container.
Step 5: Every 12 hours, cut a thin slice off the stalk end to renew flow.
Step 6: For nipa palms, work at ground level with shoots growing from base.
Step 7: For other species, climb tree to reach flowering stalk.
warnings: Ripe coconut milk contains strong laxatives - drinking too much causes fluid loss.
Climbing tall palms is dangerous - ensure secure footing.
Cut thin slices only - cutting too much stops the flow.
